name: Pad Thai
ingredients: 6 oz. tofu, cut into small pieces
method: 1. Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 20-30 minutes. 2. In a small bowl, whisk together the fish sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes. 3. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and green onions and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 4. Add the shrimp and tofu and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until the shrimp are pink and cooked through. 5. Add the soaked rice noodles and the sauce to the wok or skillet and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, or until everything is well combined. 6. Add the bean sprouts and half of the chopped peanuts to the wok or skillet and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes, or until the bean sprouts are slightly wilted. 7. Serve the Pad Thai hot, garnished with the remaining chopped peanuts.

name: Green Curry Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into small pieces
method: 1. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until lightly browned. 2. Add the bell pepper, onion, and garlic to the saucepan or Dutch oven and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly softened. 3. Add the green curry paste, fish sauce, and brown sugar to the saucepan or Dutch oven and stir to combine. 4. Add the coconut milk to the saucepan or Dutch oven and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly. 5. Stir in the lime juice and chopped cilantro. 6. Serve the green curry chicken hot over steamed rice.

name: Mango Sticky Rice
method:
1. In a pot, combine the rice and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and let simmer for 20 minutes.
2. In another pot, combine the coconut milk, sugar, and salt and cook over medium heat until the sugar has dissolved.
3. Add the cooked rice to the coconut milk mixture and stir to combine. Let simmer for 5-10 minutes until the mixture thickens.
4. Remove from heat and let cool for a few minutes.
5. Serve the sticky rice topped with sliced mangoes and toasted sesame seeds. Enjoy!

name: Massaman Curry Beef
ingredients: 1 lb beef stew meat, cut into cubes
1 potato, peeled and cut into chunks
method:
1. Heat a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the beef cubes and brown on all sides.
2. Add the curry paste and stir to coat the beef. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3. Add the coconut milk, beef broth, potato chunks, onion, tamarind paste, brown sugar, cinnamon stick, and bay leaf. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and let simmer for 1-2 hours until the beef is tender.
5. Stir in the chopped peanuts, and let simmer for another 5-10 minutes.
6. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice. Enjoy!

name: Tom Kha Gai (Coconut Chicken Soup)
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
method:
1. In a large pot, combine the coconut milk, chicken broth, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and red chilies. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
2. Add the chicken and mushrooms, and let simmer for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
3. Stir in the fish sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
4. Serve hot, garnished with cilantro leaves. Enjoy!

name: Tom Kha Gai (Coconut Chicken Soup)
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
method:
1. In a large pot, combine the coconut milk, chicken broth, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and red chilies. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
2. Add the chicken and mushrooms, and let simmer for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
3. Stir in the fish sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
4. Serve hot, garnished with cilantro leaves. Enjoy!

name: Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)
method:
1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded green papaya, cherry tomatoes, and chopped green beans.
2. In a mortar and pestle, pound the garlic and bird's eye chilies until well mashed.
3. Add the palm sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice, and continue to pound until well combined.
4. Pour the dressing over the papaya mixture and toss well to coat.
5. Top with roasted peanuts and cilantro leaves. Serve chilled. Enjoy!

name: Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)
method:
1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded green papaya, cherry tomatoes, and chopped green beans.
2. In a mortar and pestle, pound the garlic and bird's eye chilies until well mashed.
3. Add the palm sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice, and continue to pound until well combined.
4. Pour the dressing over the papaya mixture and toss well to coat.
5. Top with roasted peanuts and cilantro leaves. Serve chilled. Enjoy!

name: Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)
method:
1. In a large bowl, combine the shredded green papaya, cherry tomatoes, and chopped green beans.
2. In a mortar and pestle, pound the garlic and bird's eye chilies until well mashed.
3. Add the palm sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice, and continue to pound until well combined.
4. Pour the dressing over the papaya mixture and toss well to coat.
5. Top with roasted peanuts and cilantro leaves. Serve chilled. Enjoy!

name: Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai)
method: Heat the oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and chilies and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the ground chicken and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Add the onion and bell pepper and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add the soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and sugar and stir-fry until everything is is well combined. Stir in the basil leaves and cook until wilted, about 1-2 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Thai Cashew Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size pieces
method: In a large wok or skillet, heat the oil over high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the chicken and stir-fry until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Add the onion and bell pepper and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add the cashews, scallions, soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, sugar, and black pepper, and stir-fry until everything is well combined and heated through, about 2-3 minutes. Serve hot with rice.

name: Thai Basil Fried Rice
ingredients: 3 cups cooked jasmine rice, preferably chilled overnight
method: Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and chilies and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the onion and bell pepper and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add the eggs and stir-fry until scrambled and cooked through, about 1-2 minutes. Add the rice, soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and sugar, and stir-fry until everything is well combined and heated through, about 2-3 minutes. Stir in the basil leaves and cook until wilted, about 1-2 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Sticky Thai Chicken Wings
method: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly grease with cooking spray. In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, brown sugar, fish sauce, rice vinegar, Sriracha sauce, garlic, and ginger. Add the chicken wings to the bowl and toss to coat. Arrange the chicken wings in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 40-45 minutes, turning the wings halfway through, until crispy and cooked through. In a small saucepan, heat the remaining sauce over medium heat until it thickens and reduces by half, about 5-7 minutes. Brush the sauce over the cooked chicken wings and sprinkle with chopped cilantro and green onions. Serve hot.

name: Thai Chicken Buddha Bowls
method: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with foil and lightly greased with cooking spray. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. Once cooled, slice the chicken into bite-size pieces. In a large skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the bell peppers and sauté for 3-4 minutes until tender. Divide the quinoa among four bowls, and top with the sliced chicken, sautéed bell peppers, grated carrots, sliced cucumber, and sliced avocado. Sprinkle chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro over the top of each bowl. Serve immediately.

name: Thai Pineapple Fried Rice
ingredients: 3 cups cooked jasmine rice, preferably chilled overnight
method: Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the onion and garlic and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant. Add the bell pepper and pineapple and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. Add the rice, frozen peas, soy sauce, fish sauce, oyster sauce, and curry powder, and stir-fry until everything is well combined and heated through, about 2-3 minutes. Add the chopped cashews and green onions and stir-fry for an additional minute. Serve hot.

name: Thai Steak Salad
method: In a large resealable plastic bag, mix together the soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, fish sauce, garlic, chili flakes, cilantro, and mint. Add the flank steak to the bag, seal, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or up to 24 hours. Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Remove the steak from the marinade and discard the marinade. Grill the steak for 3-4 minutes per side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness. Let the steak rest for 5 minutes before slicing thinly against the grain. In a large salad bowl, mix together the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, sliced cucumber, and thinly sliced red onion. Top with the sliced steak and chopped roasted peanuts. Serve with extra lime wedges on the side.

name: Thai Red Curry Noodle Soup
method: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the Thai red curry paste and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Pour in the chicken or vegetable broth and coconut milk, and stir in the fish sauce and brown sugar. Bring the soup to a simmer and let it cook for 10 minutes. While the soup is simmering, cook the rice noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and rinse the noodles with cold water. Add the sliced bell pepper, carrot, zucchini, and snow peas to the soup and simmer for another 5 minutes, until the vegetables are tender. Divide the cooked noodles among four bowls, and ladle the soup over the top of the noodles. Serve hot with lime wedges and fresh cilantro leaves on top.

name: Thai Shrimp Curry
ingredients: 1 lb. raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
method: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the Thai red curry paste and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Pour in the coconut milk and chicken or vegetable broth, and stir in the fish sauce and brown sugar. Bring the curry to a simmer and let it cook for 10 minutes. Add the sliced bell pepper, zucchini, and bamboo shoots, and simmer for another 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender. Add the raw shrimp to the curry and let them cook for 3-4 minutes, until they are pink and cooked through. Stir in the fresh basil and cilantro leaves. Serve the curry hot over steamed rice.

name: Thai Fish Cakes
ingredients: 1 lb. white fish fillets, skin removed and chopped
method: In a food processor, pulse the fish fillets and red curry paste until a smooth paste forms. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the egg and then stir in the fish sauce and brown sugar. Add the fish and curry paste mixture to the bowl, and stir until well combined. Fold in the chopped cilantro, green beans, and scallions. Using your hands, shape the mixture into small patties, about 2 inches in diameter. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the fish cakes and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot with lime wedges on the side.

name: Crispy Thai Laab Meatballs
method: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground pork or chicken with the chopped cilantro, mint, and scallions. Add the fish sauce, lime juice, toasted rice powder, and red chili flakes, and stir until well combined. Beat the egg in a small bowl, and then add it to the meat mixture. Stir in the panko bread crumbs until the mixture is well combined. Use your hands to form the mixture into small meatballs, about 1 inch in diameter. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with additional chopped herbs and lime wedges, if desired.

name: Crispy Thai Laab Meatballs
method: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground pork or chicken with the chopped cilantro, mint, and scallions. Add the fish sauce, lime juice, toasted rice powder, and red chili flakes, and stir until well combined. Beat the egg in a small bowl, and then add it to the meat mixture. Stir in the panko bread crumbs until the mixture is well combined. Use your hands to form the mixture into small meatballs, about 1 inch in diameter. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with additional chopped herbs and lime wedges, if desired.

name: Thai Shrimp Curry
ingredients: 1 lb. raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
method: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the Thai red curry paste and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Pour in the coconut milk and chicken or vegetable broth, and stir in the fish sauce and brown sugar. Bring the curry to a simmer and let it cook for 10 minutes. Add the sliced bell pepper, zucchini, and bamboo shoots, and simmer for another 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender. Add the raw shrimp to the curry and let them cook for 3-4 minutes, until they are pink and cooked through. Stir in the fresh basil and cilantro leaves. Serve the curry hot over steamed rice.

name: Green Curry Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into small pieces
method: 1. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until lightly browned. 2. Add the bell pepper, onion, and garlic to the saucepan or Dutch oven and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly softened. 3. Add the green curry paste, fish sauce, and brown sugar to the saucepan or Dutch oven and stir to combine. 4. Add the coconut milk to the saucepan or Dutch oven and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly. 5. Stir in the lime juice and chopped cilantro. 6. Serve the green curry chicken hot over steamed rice.

name: Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps
method: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ground chicken and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Add the cilantro, scallions, garlic, and ginger to the skillet and stir until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Pour the hoisin sauce mixture over the chicken and stir until well coated. Remove the skillet from the heat. To assemble the lettuce wraps, spoon the chicken mixture onto each lettuce leaf. Serve with lime wedges on the side.

name: Thai Chicken Satay
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into thin strips
Bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
method: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the coconut milk, red curry paste, fish sauce, brown sugar, lime juice, and vegetable oil. Add the chicken strips to the bowl and toss until well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours. When ready to cook, preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Thread the chicken strips onto the bamboo skewers. Grill the chicken skewers for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through and lightly charred. Serve hot with peanut sauce and cucumber salad, if desired.

name: Thai Chicken Satay
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into thin strips
Bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
method: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the coconut milk, red curry paste, fish sauce, brown sugar, lime juice, and vegetable oil. Add the chicken strips to the bowl and toss until well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours. When ready to cook, preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Thread the chicken strips onto the bamboo skewers. Grill the chicken skewers for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through and lightly charred. Serve hot with peanut sauce and cucumber salad, if desired.
